item.title: Repeated blockages of road drain, 22nd January
item.description:
This drain is blocked again, the resulting flood completely blocks the pedestrian crossing point. This crossing is used by hundreds of children every day going to and from Lakeside School. This morning I had to help a visually impaired lady cross the road here as her guide dog rightly would not lead her through the water. There has been no rain for hours and yet there is still over a metre wide flood here. This drainage has been a persistent problem for years but has never been satisfactorily fixed.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 263, Hatherley Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham

item.title: Deep pothole at the top of Badgeworth bridge, 21st January
item.description:

As the road narrows at this point, drivers trying to avoid the pothole are having to veer right straight onto oncoming traffic, and both sides have no visibility of each other at this point. This could result in a serious accident anytime. I had a near miss today. I‚Äôm aware that this bridge has had multiple fixes in recent years. However we‚Äôve now seen a number of potholes appearing again up and down the bridge slopes. Please could you inspect and fix these urgently as this is a main thoroughfare and a bus route.
